summary: Email correspondence between John Ray (attorney) and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding information about Jeffrey Epstein's connections to a person named Madeleine Kristoffersson and the 'BBB' organization. Ray provides details about Epstein's financial payments to Kristoffersson and her alleged involvement with underage girls.

persons.name: John Ray
persons.context: Attorney from Ray, Mitev & Associates who is providing information to the U.S. Attorney's Office about Epstein's connections to Madeleine Kristoffersson and the BBB organization.

persons.name: Madeleine Kristoffersson
persons.context: Opera singer who was Epstein's 'BBB Man of the Year' in 2002, received $150,000 from Epstein through shell entities, and allegedly had connections to underage girls through the BBB organization.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the 'BBB Man of the Year' in 2002 and allegedly paid $150,000 to Madeleine Kristoffersson through shell entities for her 'girls'.

persons.name: Hazeltine
persons.context: Mentioned in photos of 'BBB girls' teamed up with old men, included in materials sent by John Ray.

persons.name: Barbru
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who 'cleansed' photos of BBB girls from the internet.

connections.description: Epstein paid Kristoffersson $150,000 through two shell entities for her 'girls' and she was his 'BBB Man of the Year' in 2002.
Ray identifies Kristoffersson as his life partner and the source of information about Epstein and BBB.
Kristoffersson sang for a BBB function and was connected to the organization's activities involving girls.

events.title: Epstein named BBB Man of the Year
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was named 'BBB Man of the Year' in 2002 according to the correspondence.

events.title: John Ray's initial letter
events.description: John Ray sent an initial letter to the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding Epstein investigation information.

events.title: Follow-up email from John Ray
events.description: John Ray provides detailed information about Madeleine Kristoffersson's connections to Epstein and BBB, including financial payments and photos.

events.title: Prosecutor response
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney responds to John Ray, acknowledging receipt of information and stating it will be incorporated into the investigation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was named 'BBB Man of the Year' in 2002 according to the correspondence.
Epstein paid $150,000 to Madeleine Kristoffersson through two shell entities 'for her girls'.
Madeleine Kristoffersson allegedly 'slipped into the US after hiding out in Stockholm' and was considered a 'person of interest'.
John Ray references photos of 'BBB girls always teamed up with old men' that were captured before being 'cleansed' from the internet.
The correspondence suggests concerns about whether 'relevant interns were underage' in connection with the BBB organization.
